title: Won't Start
description: Diagnose a no-start condition on the Kymco AK 550i 550cc liquid-cooled parallel-twin maxi-scooter.

nodes.text: What happens when you press the start button on your AK 550i?

nodes.instructions: The AK 550i uses a large 12V battery (YTX14-BS or equivalent) to handle its twin-cylinder starter load plus extensive electronics. Measure with multimeter — should read 12.4V+. Below 12.0V = dead. The Noodoe dashboard may flicker or show errors before full battery failure. Clean terminals thoroughly.
The AK 550i has multiple fuse boxes. Check main fuse (30A), ECU fuse, fuel pump fuse, and ignition fuse. Fuse box locations: under the seat and near the battery compartment.

AK 550i interlocks: (1) Kill switch in RUN position, (2) Side stand retracted, (3) Brake lever applied while pressing start. The AK 550i uses a Smart Key system — ensure the fob is nearby and its battery is not dead (CR2032). If the Noodoe dash does not recognize the key, replace the fob battery.

nodes.warning: Do not bypass carelessly — the AK 550i starter draws high current.
nodes.instructions: Listen for a click from the starter relay when pressing start. Click + no crank = starter motor or heavy cable fault. No click = relay, wiring, or interlock fault. The AK 550i's parallel-twin requires a strong starter motor — weak connections cause clicking.

nodes.warning: Fuel is flammable. No open flames.
nodes.instructions: Turn ignition ON, listen for fuel pump prime (2-3 second buzz). The AK 550i is fuel-injected with dual throttle bodies (one per cylinder). Check fuel level — 15-liter tank. If no prime sound, check pump fuse and connector. Stale fuel (3+ months) may not ignite.

nodes.warning: High voltage — do not hold plug by electrode.
nodes.instructions: The AK 550i has TWO spark plugs (one per cylinder). Remove each plug, ground against engine, crank — look for blue spark on BOTH. If one fires and the other doesn't, check that cylinder's coil and wiring. Use diagnostic port or Noodoe error codes if available.

nodes.details: The AK 550i draws significant power at startup for the twin-cylinder starter. Check charging system after (13.5-14.8V at 3,000+ RPM). If Noodoe dash was flickering, battery was likely failing.
If it blows again, trace the short. The AK 550i's extensive electronics mean more potential short sources.
Smart Key fob uses CR2032 battery. Replace annually. Clean switch contacts with contact cleaner.
Check the heavy power cable connection first — the twin requires more cranking current than single-cylinder scooters. Clean and tighten before replacing motor.
Check kill switch connector, side stand switch, brake switch, Smart Key receiver module. Connector corrosion is common.

nodes.warning: Fire risk — no sparks near fuel.
nodes.action: Check pump fuse and connector, replace pump if faulty.
nodes.details: The AK 550i uses a higher-capacity fuel pump for dual throttle bodies. Check fuel filter as well.
15L tank. Let the fuel pump prime fully (2-3 seconds of buzzing) before cranking. Use fresh premium fuel.
The AK 550i has individual coils per cylinder. Swap coils between cylinders to confirm which coil is dead. Also check the plug cap and wire.

nodes.action: Check ECU, crank position sensor, and wiring.
nodes.details: Both cylinders dead = ECU, crank position sensor, or main ignition relay. Check for stored fault codes via diagnostic port.
Both cylinders should read 10-14 bar and be within 10% of each other. Low on one = valve or ring issue on that cylinder. Low on both = head gasket or timing. Check for coolant in oil (milky).
